p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d8 per Inquisitor level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Inquisitor level after 1st.

Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour. Weapons: Simple Blasters, Lightsaber, Lightwhip, Double Bladed Lightsaber, Vibrodagger, Vibro Double-Blade, Electrostaff, Electrowhip, Electrobaton. Saving Throws: Dexterity and Intelligence.
Skills. Choose 4 from Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth.
Spell Save DC. 8 + Charisma modifier + Proficiency Bonus.

sheet.description: A stealthy operative blending Force powers with espionage.

setters.set: A stealthy operative blending Force powers with espionage.

description.p: An Inquisitor's power comes from the dark side of the Force. You have learned to draw on this power to cast spells.
Cantrips. You know the Minor Telekinesis cantrip.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Inquisitor spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an Inquisitor spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell Attack Modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Once per turn, you can deal extra damage ({{inquisitor:assassinate:count}}d{{inquisitor:assassinate:die}}) to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. You must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

sheet.description: Once per turn, deal extra {{inquisitor:assassinate:count}}d{{inquisitor:assassinate:die}} damage if you have advantage on attack roll. Finesse or ranged weapon required. You don't need advantage if another enemy is within 5 feet and not incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage.

description.p: You use the Force to manipulate a small or medium object, or a small creature, that you can see within range. You make an ability check using your Force ability, contested by the target's Strength check. On a success, you may suspend and/or move up to 30 feet or throw the target. If you choose to suspend the target, it remains suspended for the duration. If you throw the target, make a ranged Force attack with a range of 30/60 feet. On a hit, the target you throw at takes kinetic damage based on what is thrown: Small object: 2d4 kinetic damage, Medium object: 2d6 kinetic damage, Small creature: 1d4 kinetic damage. If a creature is thrown, the thrown small creature takes 1d8 + your Force ability modifier kinetic damage.

description.p: At 3rd level, you choose a subclass that defines your specialized path: Shadow, Trickster, or Manipulator. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Reaction; When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can halve the attack's damage against you.

description.p: Shadow Inquisitors are masters of stealth and darkness, using the Force to blind their enemies, cloak themselves in invisibility, and move unseen through the battlefield.
At 3rd level, you learn to use the Force to manipulate shadows and perception. You learn the Force Blind and Force Cloak abilities.

description.p: Choose a target you can see within range. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is blinded. On a successful save, the creature isn't blinded.

description.p: Trickster Inquisitors are masters of deception and illusion, using the Force to disguise themselves, create phantom images, and manipulate the perceptions of others.
At 3rd level, you learn to use the Force to deceive and manipulate. You learn the Force Disguise and Phantom Stride abilities.

sheet.description: You know Force Disguise and Phantom Stride.

description.p: Use the Force to disguise yourself by altering people's perception of you.

sheet.description: Use the Force to disguise yourself by altering people's perception of you.

description.p: You can teleport to an enemy up to double your movement away. This does not break stealth unless you teleport into line of sight.

description.p: At 9th level, you can create convincing illusions to distract your enemies. As a bonus action, create an illusion within 60 feet. Targets who can see it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they become distracted (attackers have advantage against them, they have disadvantage on saves) until hit or for 2 rounds.

sheet.description: Create illusion within 60 feet. Wis save or distracted (attackers have adv, dis on saves) until hit or 2 rounds.

description.p: Use the Force to make an illusion within range. Targets who can see the illusion must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes distracted. Creatures attacking a distracted target have advantage, and distracted targets have disadvantage on saving throws. As soon as they're hit, they are no longer distracted. On a successful save, the creature isn't distracted.

description.p: At 13th level, you can manifest a creature's worst fears. As an action, all creatures within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they become frightened for 1 round.

At 3rd level, you learn to use the Force to manipulate minds and control others. You learn the Mind Trap and Force Stasis abilities.

description.p: At 17th level, you can link your life force to a hostile creature. As an action, choose one creature within 60 feet. For 3 rounds, whenever you take damage, they must make an Int save. On a failure, they take half the damage you would have taken (as kinetic damage), and you take half damage. On a success, they take no damage and you take full damage. You can only have one link active at a time.

sheet.description: Link to one hostile creature within 60 feet for 3 rounds. When you take damage, they Int save: fail = they take half (kinetic), you take half; success = they take none, you take full.

description.p: Use the Force to link your life force to a hostile creature. Whenever you take damage, the linked creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes half of the damage as kinetic damage you would have taken and you take half of the damage as the damage type of the original attack. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage and you take full damage as the damage type of the original attack. You can only link to one creature.
